channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: European Airline Shares Rise as Oil Falls
item.description: The European airline sector posted solid gains after crude futures fell sharply thanks to easing concerns over disruptions to Iranian supplies and a w...

item.title: Oil slides after report Israel won’t target Iran’s oil facilities
item.description: Oil futures tumbled after a report that Israel will not attack key oil facilities in Iran.

item.title: UBS has just lowered earnings estimates — and raised its S&P 500 target
item.description: UBS on Tuesday issued an unusual pairing, reducing its estimates for earnings growth while at the same time lifting its S&P 500 target for this year a...

item.title: Euro Falls Ahead of Expected ECB Rate Cut
item.description: The euro fell to a two-and-a-half-month low against the dollar ahead of the ECB’s meeting on Thursday when the central bank is expected to deliver ano...

item.title: IEA Trims Oil-Demand Forecast for Third Consecutive Month
item.description: The International Energy Agency trimmed its forecast for this year’s oil-demand growth for the third month in a row, as a rapid slowdown in Chinese co...

item.title: Oil Plunges on Easing Iranian Supply-Disruption Fears, Weaker Demand Outlook
item.description: Oil prices fell 4% in early European trade following a report suggesting Israel was planning a more limited counter-strike against Iran than some had ...

item.title: ‘It’s so unfair!’ I’m miserable in my job. I’m 58 and have $1 million in a 401(k) and Roth IRA. Can I afford to quit?
item.description: “Currently, I live comfortably on $5,000 a month, but I could probably live on $3,500 a month.”

item.title: Uncertainty around the elusive ‘neutral’ interest rate could pose a real risk for markets
item.description: Nobody can say for sure where the “neutral” rate for the U.S. economy lies. As the Fed starts cutting, that’s making some on Wall Street nervous about...

item.title: Gold Futures Tick Up Slightly as Market Awaits More U.S. Data
item.description: Gold futures broadly held ground near their all-time high and appeared well-supported by safe-haven demand as geopolitical tensions continued to simme...

item.title: ‘Don’t be naïve’: I have a wake-up call for divorcing women — you’ve been giving up too much for too long. Am I wrong?
